001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.Array;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.StaticUtility;
005
006/**
007 * Implements utility functions to operate on floats
008 */
009@StaticUtility
010public final class Floats {
011
012    /**
013     * The EPSILON we are using for considering floats equal. (solve problems like: 0,99999999... vs 1,0)
014     */
015    public static final float EPSILON = 1e-6f;
016
017    public static final float[] EMPTY = new float[0];
018
019    private Floats() {
020    }
021
022    /**
023     * Returns true if float a and b are closer than EPSILON from each other.
024     *
025     * @param a the float to compare to b
026     * @param b the float to compare to a
027     * @return if the floats are (enough) equal
028     */
029    public static boolean equals(float a, float b) {
030        return Math.abs(a - b) < EPSILON;
031    }
032
033    /**
034     * Returns true if float a and b are not equal (differ)
035     *
036     * @param a the float to compare to b
037     * @param b the float to compare to a
038     * @return true if the floast are different
039     * @see #equals(float, float)
040     */
041    public static boolean notEquals(float a, float b) {
042        return !equals(a, b);
043    }
044
045    /**
046     * Easy way to create float arrays in java
047     *
048     * @param f the floats to put in the array
049     * @return the array
050     */
051    public static Array<Float> of(Float... f) {
052        return Array.of(f);
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Returns true if f1 is greater than f2
057     *
058     * @param f1 the float to compare to f2
059     * @param f2 the float to compare to f1
060     * @return if f1 greater than f2
061     * @see #notEquals(float, float)
062     */
063    public static boolean greaterThan(float f1, float f2) {
064        return f1 > f2 && notEquals(f1, f2);
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Converts an array of floats to a boolean array. True if the float is positive
069     *
070     * @param floats the floats to convert
071     * @return the corresponding booleans
072     */
073    public static Array<Boolean> toBooleans(Array<Float> floats, float threshold) {
074        Array<Boolean> booleans = Array.of(new Boolean[floats.length()]);
075        for (int i = 0; i < floats.length(); i++) {
076            booleans.set(i, floats.get(i) >= threshold);
077        }
078        return booleans;
079    }
080
081    public static boolean[] toBooleans(Float[] floats, float threshold) {
082        boolean[] booleans = new boolean[floats.length];
083        for (int i = 0; i < floats.length; i++) {
084            booleans[i] = floats[i] >= threshold;
085        }
086        return booleans;
087    }
088}
